p: Regarding the antimicrobial activity against human pathogens carried out by EOs of species belonging to the Verbenaceae family in South America, the main genera studied were Lippia (51.79%), Lantana (26.79%) and Aloysia (16.03%). There are few works about Stachytarpheta (3.6%) and Phyla (1.8%). The main contributions were given by Brazil (86.11%) in most species of all genera of the family. Other contributions were supplied by Argentina (5.56%), Colombia (5.56%), and Peru (2.78%).
